main.java.controller

Class EditRuleController

  • java.lang.Object
    • main.java.controller.EditRuleController

  • public class EditRuleController
extends java.lang.Object
    Controller responsible for managing the rule edition and addition GUI

    • Method Detail

      • initActionListeners

        private void initActionListeners()
        Add action listeners to Save and Delete buttons from Edit Rule Popup

      • onDeleteHandler

        private void onDeleteHandler()
        Sets a handler for the Edit Rule Popup delete button's action. Triggers a deleteRule method.

      • deleteRule

        public void deleteRule()
                throws java.lang.Exception
        Tries to delete a rule from the rulesList. Only deletes a rule if it isn't a default rule and if it is present in the rules list. Throws an exception otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - - Exception with the error message of the issue found.

      • onSaveHandler

        private void onSaveHandler()
        Sets a handler for the Edit Rule Popup save button's action. Triggers a saveRule method.

      • saveRule

        public void saveRule()
              throws java.lang.Exception
        Tries to save a rule. It checks for the rule's content and name. It won't save a new rule without a name or set conditions. It also validates the conditions' validity before saving. Throws an exception otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - - Exception with the error message of the issue found.

      • getJavascriptIfStatementString

        public java.lang.String getJavascriptIfStatementString(java.lang.String rawRuleConditions)
        Parses the rule string from the Edit Rule Popup to use keywords valid for Javascript code.
        Parameters:
        rawRuleConditions - - receives a string with the rule's conditions
        Returns:
        Returns a javascript-ready string for evaluation.

      • preValidateJavascriptCode

        private void preValidateJavascriptCode(java.lang.String rule)
                                throws javax.script.ScriptException
        This method will pre validate the Javascript format rule to find any initial issues with the statement format. Will add mock data for metrics and evaluate the string. Throws an exception if the string if founds to be invalid. Runs normally when no initial issues are found. This is just a prevalidation, and doesn't eliminate the necessity of using a try/catch when running the rule against the real data.
        Parameters:
        rule - - An if statement rule in Javascript format to be validated
        Throws:
        javax.script.ScriptException - - When the validation of the rule's conditions finds an issue, it throws an exception

      • isValidDefaultRuleThresholdsUpdate

        private boolean isValidDefaultRuleThresholdsUpdate(java.lang.String ruleName,
                                                   java.lang.String rule)
        This method validates if the default rules have their format respected and that only the threshold values have been edited. It uses a regex tailored for each custom rule to validate the edited rule. In case the rule name provided isn't of a known default rule, returns false.
        Parameters:
        ruleName - - The name of the rule to be validated
        rule - - The rule string to be validated
        Returns:
        boolean - If the rule has a valid format

      • getEditRulePopup

        public EditRulePopup getEditRulePopup()
        Getter for an instance of EditRulePopup
        Returns:
        EditRulePopup controlled by this controller instance

      • getRule

        public CodeQualityRule getRule()
        Getter for the rule being edited or added
        Returns:
        CodeQualityRule
